image.altText: A close-up photo of a man standing next to a woman with a blurred face.

props.synopsis: Alberto Nicoletti, the former owner and manager of an Italian restaurant in Como, has pleaded not guilty to 11 charges for a series of alleged sexual assaults.

title.children: Italian restaurant owner on trial over string of alleged sexual assaults on women across Perth

image.altText: Three separate images detailing the injuries a woman suffered in a assault, showing black eyes and swelling.

props.synopsis: A woman violently assaulted during a night out in Kalgoorlie shares the physical and emotional trauma she has suffered since, as her attacker has his prison sentence suspended.

title.children: FIFO worker avoids jail over taxi rank attack that left woman unconscious

image.altText: Anthony Albanese, wearing a hat, walks among indigenous performers.

props.synopsis: Prime Minister Anthony Albanese has denied his government has failed to outline a way forward on Indigenous policy following last year's unsuccessful Voice referendum.

title.children: PM says government is 'looking for other ways to bring about' progress on Closing the Gap targets

props.synopsis: Fiji's former prime minister Frank Bainimarama will spend the night in police custody after being charged with abuse of office.

title.children: Fiji's former PM Frank Bainimarama to spend night behind bars after abuse of office charge

image.altText: Michele Bullock, looking at journalists, wearing a light blazer, standing at a podium, during a press conference

props.synopsis: The Reserve Bank Board keeps interest rates at 4.35 per cent following inflation falling by more than expected towards the end of 2023.

title.children: RBA boss doesn't rule out future increases as rates hold at 4.35pc

image.altText: Teenagers harass supermarket

props.synopsis: Concerns are raised about groups of children stealing from supermarkets, after a "distressing" incident at a remote Kimberley store during which teens stole drinks and confectionary and tried to break into a cigarette cabinet.

title.children: Teens scare staff while 'swarming' remote supermarket, sparking fears of wider trend

image.altText: A man on stage holding a guitar.

props.synopsis: The announcement of his death was made on his social media.

title.children: US country music singer Toby Keith dead at 62

image.altText: A woman at the train station in the evening checks her smartphone

props.synopsis: If you've ever found yourself replying to a 10pm email, or fielding a phone call from the boss during a Saturday afternoon barbecue, and wondered "should I be getting paid for this?", the answer is … maybe.

title.children: You might soon have the right to 'disconnect' from work. Here's what else may be on the way

image.altText: A close up of an Indigenous Australian woman sitting and smiling indoors, with other people sitting behind her

props.synopsis: The late Lowitja O'Donoghue is being remembered for her trailblazing spirit, with leaders acknowledging she changed Australia's relationship with Indigenous affairs.

title.children: 'A compliment and a whack': Prime ministers reflect on Lowitja's legacy

image.altText: A 70-year-old woman with shoulder length brown hair sitting down.

props.synopsis: Five teenagers have been charged as police continue to investigate the stabbing death of a 70-year-old grandmother at an Ipswich shopping centre.

title.children: Parents of teens arrested over grandmother's death at shopping centre 'condemn what's occurred,' police say

image.altText: King Charles and Rishi Sunak

props.synopsis: British Prime Minister Rishi Sunak has told the BBC he is "shocked and sad" to hear of King Charles's cancer diagnosis.

title.children: British PM says he is thankful King Charles's cancer was 'caught early'

image.altText: Clive Palmer poses for a photograph in front of a statue of Jeff the dinosaur.

props.synopsis: Billionaire businessman and former politician Clive Palmer has lost his Court of Appeal bid to have criminal charges against him and his company thrown out, with three judges determining he "abused" the court process.

title.children: Clive Palmer loses appeal to have criminal charges thrown out

image.altText: Young Wollemi Pine.

props.synopsis: The Wollemi Pine was thought to have gone extinct two million years ago, until an off-duty ranger stumbled across a grove. Now, experts are doing everything they can to give the tree a second chance.

title.children: The top secret mission to preserve the 'botanical find of the century'

image.altText: A composite of two screenshots from social media videos showing Tesla drivers using Apple Vision Pro headsets while driving

props.synopsis: The US transportation secretary warns drivers must pay attention at all times, even if their car has assisted driving capabilities.

title.children: Viral videos of Tesla drivers using Apple's Vision Pro prompt US government warning

image.altText: A screenshot with a red box highlighting some Chinese characters that were changed in a transcript of a press conference.

props.synopsis: Yesterday, China sentenced Yang Hengjun to death. But a minor tweak in a press conference transcript from years ago sheds light on a potential reprieve, writes Bang Xiao.

title.children: Beijing edits Yang Hengjun's online record in a hint of what might lie ahead

image.altText: A women with blonde hair tied back into a ponytail looks towards the camera.

props.synopsis: The former head of medical services at a major Tasmanian hospital allegedly falsified medical certificates of death, a registered nurse and midwife tells a parliamentary committee.

title.children: Launceston hospital former top doctor allegedly covered up causes of death to avoid coronial scrutiny, nurse claims

image.altText: A man wearing a light blue suit looks out the corner of his eyes as he walks up steps

props.synopsis: The former Wallaby player repeatedly apologised for 'misreading the situation' in a call to the complainant recorded by police.

title.children: Kurtley Beale told manager in tapped call 'a bird' said she hadn't consented to oral sex, court told

image.altText: A man and woman embrace with a Māori hongi, nose to nose, while a child sleeps on the woman's shoulder

props.synopsis: This year's Waitangi Day is bigger than any of the past 30 years, as Māori from all over Aotearoa unite against a controversial government bill that could change the Treaty of Waitangi.

title.children: 'They have no business with that treaty': Māori protesters clash with NZ prime minister in Waitangi

image.altText: A sweeping view of an outback property with brown water covering most of it.

props.synopsis: Landholders in eastern parts of the country are still in shock after ex-Tropical Cyclone Kirrily caused a year's worth of rain to fall in just two days, drenching their properties.

title.children: Graziers describe 'unbelievable' rainfall in parts of far north-west NSW and south-west Queensland

image.altText: A dejected West Indies batter looks down at his feet while a big screen behind him shows a sign "Oh what a wicket!".

props.synopsis: The Australians don't need the whole of the first powerplay to finish off the final ODI against the West Indies, after another brilliant bowling performance and a fierce cameo from Jake Fraser-McGurk.

title.children: Australia thrash West Indies in final ODI in Canberra

image.altText: Najib Razak leaves KL court house

props.synopsis: For many Malaysians, the reduced punishment for disgraced former leader Najib Razak is seen as the ultimate betrayal, with authorities appearing to go soft on a corrupt 70-year-old whose ill-gotten gains once helped fund a Hollywood movie.

title.children: Malaysians outraged by halved jail sentence for disgraced former PM Najib

image.altText: Tony Mokbel leaves the Melbourne Magistrates' Court with his lawyers Nicola Gobbo and Con Heliotis.

props.synopsis: Crime kingpin Tony Mokbel appears in court to appeal his conviction, saying disgraced barrister Nicola Gobbo encouraged him to flee overseas in 2006, when she told him she'd received a police tip-off.

title.children: Nicola Gobbo told me to flee Australia, crime kingpin Tony Mokbel tells court

image.altText: a man looking

props.synopsis: Youssef Assoum was shot in the leg at close range in December 2014 and died from severe blood loss, court documents read.

title.children: Former Comanchero kingpin and brother have murder charges dropped after plea deal

image.altText: A dog in a cage

props.synopsis: Council rangers have removed the dog after it attacked a woman in her 30s on a south-west Sydney street.

title.children: Police taser dog after woman attacked in south-west Sydney street

image.altText: Lucy kisses her Grammy as Phoebe leans in and laughs as Taylor Swift ducks into the group photo as well.

props.synopsis: The Grammys hit a high note this year, drawing an audience of nearly 17 million viewers as the three-hour ceremony focused on celebrating some of the most successful women in the industry.

title.children: Grammys emerge from flop era as viewership jumps 34 per cent

image.altText: Taylor Swift holding a Grammy and smiling widely wearing a white sleeveless evening gown and long black gloves

props.synopsis: While Taylor Swift's fans pride themselves on keeping up with her clues, even they were caught off guard by the news a new album is on its way.

title.children: Taylor Swift's understanding of the element of surprise is her best marketing tool

image.altText: An unusual looking dolphin with multicoloured skin.

props.synopsis: Researchers believe they have recorded one of the world's most unusually coloured dolphins for the first time in Australian waters.

title.children: Rare dolphin, only photographed six times, believed to be spotted in Australian waters

image.altText: Opposition Leader Peter Dutton speaks to the media at a press conference

props.synopsis: Opposition Leader Peter Dutton laughs off Malcolm Turnbull's description of him as a "thug" and accuses him of "retrofitting" a narrative to suit his own purposes.

title.children: Dutton brushes off Turnbull's description of him as a 'thug'

image.altText: A man smiles while sitting on a couch

props.synopsis: The defence tells a Queensland District Court that Yohannes Abate Faris "honestly believed" the encounter was consensual as the jury retires to consider its verdict.

title.children: Jury retires in trial of doctor accused of raping woman he met on Christian dating site

image.altText: Mum Emma and son Julian gaming together on the couch.

props.synopsis: New research shows more than half of young children who play online games wish their parents would game with them — and that joining in can help keep kids safe online.

title.children: Emma never planned on becoming a 'gaming mum'. It turns out that joining her son's games could have benefits beyond fun

image.altText: LeBron James and Bronny James on court after a USC Trojans college basketball game.

props.synopsis: LeBron James wants to play a season on the same team as his son, Bronny, but Austin Rivers is warning against linking up with your dad in the NBA.

title.children: 'You're only in the league because of your dad': A former NBA star has a warning for LeBron and Bronny James

image.altText: A car drives along a beach-side road lined with shops.

props.synopsis: For many fed-up Australians struggling to afford record-high rents, short-term rentals like Airbnbs are an easy scapegoat. But is that the reality? The answer, just like the problem, isn't straightforward.

title.children: The town where local workers live in hotels and caravans, and tourists stay in the houses

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and Peter Dutton smiling at each other.

props.synopsis: The federal government's amended tax cuts will pass parliament without Labor needing to strike a deal with the Greens, with the Coalition deciding to support the cuts in a partyroom meeting.

title.children: Stage 3 tax cuts to pass parliament after Coalition announces it will support them

image.altText: An Australian soldier in camoflague gear knees on the dirt and throws preschooler a Sherrin AFL football.

props.synopsis: A relationship that's built on mutual respect between Australian soldiers, US Marines and traditional owners is empowering the people of Timber Creek and ensuring the protection of their cultural history.

title.children: Since soldiers moved to this former cattle station, a deeply respectful relationship has unfolded
